page.title: 20Transport in Dean
page.content: Many of the villagers have cars of their own, though many use bicycles and even horses around the villages and to other villages. A bus service operates 4 times a day in both directions, but the last bus leaves Bedford around 6pm. The service links St. Neots, Kimbolton, Tilbrook,Lower and Upper Dean and Bedford, costing Â£1 single for the trip from Dean to Bedford and taking about 45 minutes. There ate 2 school buses serving Dean. 1 at 7.45am collects the older children for Sharnbrook Upper School; 1 at 8.15am takes the younger children to either Eileen Wade School in Upper Dean or Margaret Beaufort School in Riseley. 1 bus brings all the children home at about 4.15pm.
